data.title: Hazen's Notch Association
data.meta_description: Located at the top of Vermont in the “Covered Bridge Town” of Montgomery near the Jay Peak Resort, Hazen’s Notch is on the western edge of the beautiful, uncrowded and snowy Northeast Kingdom. 60 kilometers of groomed and marked trails pass through mixed maple, birch and evergreen forest and across gentle,…
data.text:
Located at the top of Vermont in the “Covered Bridge Town” of Montgomery near the Jay Peak Resort, Hazen’s Notch is on the western edge of the beautiful, uncrowded and snowy Northeast Kingdom. 60 kilometers of groomed and marked trails pass through mixed maple, birch and evergreen forest and across gentle, open meadows.

There are spectacular views of Hazen’s Notch and numerous peaks over 3,000 in elevation in the Jay Range and Cold Hollow Range of the Green Mountains which completely encircle the trail system. 25 trails for all abilities provide loops of different lengths for classical crosscountry skiing and or snowshoeing. Trail difficulty is evenly divided between

easy, moderate and difficult.
